lines.text: Hey, waiter. C'mere.
Yes sir, Mr. Bogart. Ah, we have some vewy nice...
Cut the gab and bring me an order of fried rabbit.
Oh, I'm vewy sorry, Mr. Bogart. But we're just fwesh out of wabbit. Heh-heh-heh-heh. We got some vewy nice Cwepe Suzzette.

[Picking up Elmer by the lapels]
I said I want rabbit, and I'll give you just 20 minutes to bring it, or else.
[lays a gun on the table]

[nervous]
Yes, sir, Mr. Bogart. The customer is always wight. Heh-heh-heh, heh-heh.

[Closing lines]
Well, time's up, shorty. Where's my rabbit?
Pwease, Mr. Bogart. I couldn't get a wabbit. I twied and I twied.
Oh, yeah? Well, I guess there's just one thing left for me to do.
[reaches into his coat pocket]
Don't! Pwease, don't!

[Pulling out a handkerchief to wipe his brow]
Baby will just have to have a ham sandwich, instead.
Baby?
[Bugs comes out of his hiding place and hops onto Bogart's table, placing himself on the dinner plate as the main course. Sitting there is "Baby" - Lauren Bacall]
Remember, garçon. The customer is always right. If it's rabbit baby wants, rabbit baby gets.
[Bugs then howls and wolf whistles at Bacall]

[as Groucho Marx]
I hope you won't mind waiting while I remove these wet things and slip into a dry martini.
Ah, my public. How they love me.

[Disguised as waiter]
One lemon meringue pie!
One wemon mewingue pie coming up!
[Goes behind counter and gets pie]
Pick up pie!

[enters kitchen, picks up pie]
Roger!
[Enters again and hits Elmer in face with pie]
Your pie, sir!
[Leaves and enters again]
One banana cream pie!
[Leaves]
One banana cweam pie coming up! Pick up pie!

[Same as before]
Roger! Your pie, sir! One coconut custard pie with whipped cream!
One coconut custard pie with whipped cweam coming up! Say, you know what I think? I think that's the wabbit. Well, he who waughs wast... He he he! Pick up pie!
Rogerini!
[as Bugs enters, Elmer throws the pie; Bugs ducks and the pie goes over his head; Enter Bogart with pie on his face]
Why did you hit me in the face with a coconut custard pie with whipped cream?
Pwease, Mr. Bogart...!
Now listen, chubby. You got just five more minutes to get me my rabbit. Get me?
Eh, what's up, Doc?
Pardon me, Mister Wabbit, but Mr. Humphwey Bogart would just wove to have you for dinner.
Yeah? Well, that's mighty neighborly of him. You tell Bogie if he wants me, all he has to do is just whistle.
[Turns on a tea kettle to make it whistle; pops up wearing coattails and top hat]
Good evening, Maitre d'. Am I the first to arrive? Eh, by the way, what's on the menu for tonight? In other words... eh, what's cooking, doc?
Oh, eh, something vewy special. Fried wabbit.
Fried wabbit? Mmm-mm! Love it, love it, looove it! Eh, let's have a peek at it, shall we?
Well, wight over here.
[Puts a mirror in the pot for Bugs to see himself in it]
Now there's a delicious-looking rabbit.
[Realizes he's looking at his reflection; turns to Elmer]

[Very fast]
Oh, I just remembered, previous engagement, I must be going, my apologies to Mr. Bogart, matter of life and death, unavoidable, gotta go.
